intro: Angelica saxicola var. taneyoshiana, commonly known as the Taneyoshiana angelica, is a rare and delicate herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare species of conservation concern.
